alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 20 at 2:32PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HANCOCK AND MCDONOUGH COUNTIES... At 232 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Chatton, or 17 miles south of Carthage, moving northeast at 45 mph. A second severe storm was located near Bentley. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Denver around 235 PM CDT. Augusta and Hancock County Fairgrounds around 240 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Plymouth, Colmar, Colchester, Tennessee, Fandon, Argyle Lake State Park, Macomb, Western Illinois University, McDonough County 4-H Grounds, Spring Lake and Macomb Municipal Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Illinois. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities.
